activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch I

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on December 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Nicolas Wade Anderson appeared by phone.  Attorney Russell Edward Hammer appeared by video for Nicolas Wade Anderson.  Attorney Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Reporter appears via DAR. Attorney states that they are close to a resolution and requests a pre-trial conference. Court adjourns.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicolas Wade Anderson appeared by phone at 9:23am for 8:30am hearing.  Attorney Bettthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gericke appeared by video for Attorney Hammer for Nicolas Wade Anderson. Attorney waives reading of information. Court enters Not Guilty Pleas.

Defendant Nicolas Wade Anderson appeared by phone at 9:23am for 8:30am hearing.  Attorney Bettthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gericke appeared by video for Attorney Hammer for Nicolas Wade Anderson. Attorney Hammer appears via zoom video at 9:33am. Court issued $250 warrant, but quashed the warrant when defendant appeared. Defendant waives rights for a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and will bind over for trial. 
Defendant is instructed to update address with the clerk of courts office.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
